unused.str:
Latest News:

 The Armory can now be accessed via eu.wowarmory.com!

Tip: 

Use the \"Desired By\" filter in the Advanced Items Search for better results!

Tip: 

Try the Find an Upgrade feature to quickly find upgrades for your character!

strs.str: The Armory is currently undergoing maintenance. Please check back later.

common.str: The World of Warcraft Armory is a vast searchable database of information for World of Warcraft - taken straight from the real servers. It is the most comprehensive and up-to-date database on the characters, arena teams, guilds, items, dungeons, raids, bosses, and faction rewards of World of Warcraft in existence.
Search must be at least 2 characters long

We've detected that you either do not have Adobe Flash Player or are using a version prior to version 8. The Armory requires Flash Player 8 (or later) in order to take full advantage of all the site's features. Click the button above to install the latest version of Adobe Flash Player.
This link will take you outside the Armory.
This link will take you outside the Armory

To pin a profile, search for and find a character

legend.str: These special arena icons are a visible symbol of your team's prowess in the Arena. As your team's standing on the arena ladder increases, your icon will become correspondingly more impressive.

Too many search results. Try filtering.

Only items that have been 'discovered' in-game (at least one of that item has been acquired) are searchable in the Armory. As a result, some boss loot tables (particularly those of newer raid bosses) may be incomplete, and may appear conspicuously sparse. The loot tables for these and other bosses should gradually populate over time as more of their items are discovered.
** In order to see the latest additions to this page, you may need to clear your browser's cache. **
Your search did not produce any results. To ensure that you're searching by parameters allowed by the Armory, make sure to:
Only search for the categories currently in the Armory: items, characters, arena teams, guilds, dungeons, bosses, and factions.
Only search by the name of the items, character, arena team, guild, dungeon, boss, or faction you are looking for.

items.str: Use this filter along with the item type and slot filters to give you a master list of the most sought-after items for every class in each inventory slot.

deleted.str: Your search did not produce any results. To ensure that you're searching by parameters allowed by the Armory, make sure to:
Only search for the categories currently in the Armory: characters, arena teams, and guilds. Other categories, such as items, will be added in the future.
Only search by the name of the character, arena team, or guild you are looking for.

characterSheet.str: It seems like the character you are trying to view hasn't been active for a while. Since the Armory only tracks active characters, this character needs to have been active recently for detailed character data to show up.
Must be at least level 10 for Character Profiles

arenaCalc.str: How many arena points will I earn this week?
What's the average rating I'll need to get my desired arena reward?
When can I expect to get my desired arena reward?

str.p: Each team has a Team Rating. This rating reflects how well your team is doing in the Arena System; the higher your rating, the better. Every time your team wins a match, your rating goes up, and every time you lose a match, your rating goes down. The amount by which your rating changes depends on your team's rating compared to the other team's rating. As a frame of reference, playing a team with a rating within a close range of your own team's rating will result in a net change of 16 rating.

At the end of each week, your Team Rating is used to calculate how many Arena Points your team will receive for this week. Your team must have played a minimum of ten matches per week to be rewarded with Arena Points, and a team member must have been in at least 30% of the week’s matches to be eligible for that week's points. It is important to note that the points you receive in a given week is determined by only one team, and not by combining all your teams' points. Whichever team you are a member of that would receive the most points after accounting for Team Rating and team type becomes the sole source for your points for that week. Note that 2v2 and 3v3 teams are subject to a handicap where they receive fewer points than a 5v5 team with the same Team Rating.

Arena Points are used as currency to purchase Arena Rewards. You can stockpile a maximum of 5,000 Arena Points and they do not decay over time. The Arena Calculator will help you determine how many points you will gain from a given rating and how many weeks it will take you to earn your next arena reward with a given rating.

arenaCalc.str: How Arena Ratings and Points are Calculated
2v2 teams earn 76% of the points of a 5v5 team with the same rating
3v3 teams earn 88% of the points of a 5v5 team with the same rating
Pin a profile to auto-populate some of the fields in the calculator. Click here to search for a profile.
Note: Arena stats are not updated in real time. The numbers above may be slightly outdated.

searchPlugin.str: Add the World of Warcraft Armory search field to your browser for instant Armory access from anywhere on the web!
Click Yes in the popup dialogue.
Drag the "WoW Armory" box from Appearance → Buttons → My buttons to your browser bar.
To add the Armory to Opera's default search engine list:
Enter the following information into the popup dialogue and hit OK:

Name: WoW Armory
Keyword: wow
Address: http://www.wowarmory.com/search.xml?searchQuery=%s&searchType=all
You should now be able to select "WoW Armory" from the dropdown list of search engines.
